title: Economics for policy advisors
desc:
This 3-day course is based on the Treasury course ‘Economics for non-economists’. It has been tailored for non-economists doing policy work at a grade 6 or 7 level.

The workshop provides an introduction to economics, markets, prices, values and macroeconomics. It covers:

  • business cycles, market failure interventions and counterfactual analysis
  • scale (size/timing/impact) of policy changes
  • cost/benefit comparison methods, their strengths and their limitations

It also touches on behavioural economics, including the reasons people act and incentives

The workshop is interactive and engaging, and includes practical exercises.

outcomes.blurb: By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
points: engage effectively with economists, and be able to explain the economic impact of your policy options
outline the key concepts and tools of macroeconomics and microeconomics
understand economic content in the media, in reports and in other non-specialist contexts
apply a broad understanding of the theoretical framework and empirical evidence that informs current policy and public debate in your policy area
